results.title: Metformin accelerates myelin recovery and ameliorates behavioral deficits in the animal model of multiple sclerosis via adjustment of AMPK/Nrf2/mTOR signaling and maintenance of endogenous oligodendrogenesis during brain self-repairing period.
results.text_hl: Moreover, we observed a significant elevation in the antioxidant responses, especially in mature OLGs (@GENE_MOG @GENE_17441 @@@MOG@@@+/@GENE_NFE2L2 @GENE_18024 @@@nuclear factor erythroid 2-related factor 2@@@ (@GENE_NFE2L2 @GENE_18024 @@@Nrf2@@@+) cells) after @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MET@@@ intervention. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MET@@@ also reduced brain apoptosis markers and lessened @<m>DISEASE_Motor_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000068079 @@@motor dysfunction@@@ in the open-field test.

citations.NLM: Sanadgol N, Barati M, Houshmand F, Hassani S, Clarner T, Shahlaei M, Golab F. Metformin accelerates myelin recovery and ameliorates behavioral deficits in the animal model of multiple sclerosis via adjustment of AMPK/Nrf2/mTOR signaling and maintenance of endogenous oligodendrogenesis during brain self-repairing period. Pharmacol Rep. 2020 Jun;72(3):641-658. PMID: 32048246

results.title: Metformin and fluoxetine improve depressive-like behavior in a murine model of Parkinsons disease through the modulation of neuroinflammation, neurogenesis and neuroplasticity.
results.text_hl: Hippocampus, prefrontal cortex, and substantia nigra were dissected for molecular and morphological analysis. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Fluoxetine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005473 @@@fluoxetine@@@ prevented @DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depressive@@@-like behavior and improved @<m>DISEASE_Motor_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000068079 @@@motor impairment@@@ and increased @GENE_TH @GENE_21823 @@@TH@@@ nigral positive cells.

citations.NLM: Mendonça IP, Paiva IHR, Duarte-Silva EP, Melo MG, Silva RSD, Oliveira WH, Costa BLDSAD, Peixoto CA. results.title: Metformin Prevents Dopaminergic Neuron Death in MPTP/P-Induced Mouse Model of Parkinson's Disease via Autophagy and Mitochondrial ROS Clearance
results.text_hl: ...@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ Improves @<m>DISEASE_Motor_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000068079 @@@Motor Impairment@@@ and Increases @CHEMICAL_Dopamine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004298 @@@Dopamine@@@ Level in the Striatum of @CHEMICAL_1_Methyl_4_phenyl_1_2_3_6_tetrahydropyridine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015632 @@@MPTP@@@/ p @DISEASE_Parkinson_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D010300 @@@PD@@@ Mice
